metadata.synopsis: Dialog between the player and Tolna. Tolna is responsible for everything book-related in the Sorcerous Sundries shop. Players can ask her about the high-end books, including the Carenthian cypher, which allows the player to read the last chapter of the Necromancy of Thay book. Players can pay a large sum for them.Tolna only speaks in whispers
metadata.how_to_trigger: Talk to Tolna in Sorcerous Sundries shop.Location: BGO_Main_A, -1765; 26; 594

29.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
29.text: (That's better. How can I help you?

103.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
103.text: (Look what you've done! By all the gods! I'd give my ear for the least bit of respect for the written word.)

38.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
38.text: (Go act the clown on your own time. Come back when you've cobbled together some manners and are prepared to pay for the damages!)

106.speaker: Player
106.text: Sorry about that, I now understand books need to be well treated. Lesson learned. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

30.speaker: Player
30.text: (How might I get permission to enter the vault?)

136.speaker: Player
136.text: I'm trying to find out about a particular Netherese crown. Have you anything on that subject?

70.speaker: Player
70.text: (I'm trying to find out about a particular Netherese crown. Have you anything on that subject?)

42.speaker: Player
42.text: I'd be interested in any especially rare tomes you might have.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: (I'd be interested in any especially rare tomes you might have.)

68.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
68.text: (Bold! You might've heard that our library has a collection other shops would lack the skill to curate.)

69.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
69.text: (Between us, even Master Lorroakan was reluctant to house them in his tower. The pen is mightier than the magic wand, apparently.)
69.context: NodeContext: With a bit of a giggle, since she's saying her books are more powerful than Lorroakan (loh-ROW-ah-kun)

117.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
117.text: (They're locked away here for their and our customers' safety. Our finest reserve includes the 'Tharchiate Codex', 'The Annals of Karsus: A Netherese Folly', 'Sights of the Seelie', and 'The Curriculum of Strategy'. Do any of those interest you?)

102.speaker: Player
102.text: ('The Annals of Karsus: A Netherese Folly'.)

120.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
120.text: (It is said to be written by Lord Karsus himself, the Netherese arcanist who attempted to replace the goddess Mystra, failed, and was banished for the attempt.)

87.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
87.text: (Great magical knowledge lies within those pages, but not many can withstand it.)

58.speaker: Gale
58.context: NodeContext: Discreet whisper to player, as if in a library

11.speaker: Gale
11.text: (I can't explain now, but it's very important we get hold of that book. Very, very important.)
11.context: NodeContext: Discreet whisper to player, as if in a library

17.speaker: Narrator
17.text: *The Annals of Karsus. Where better to learn the secrets of the crown than in the writings of the one who might have forged it?*

12.speaker: Narrator
12.text: *The Annals of Karsus. Where better to learn the secrets of the crown than in a book written by the greatest of Netherese wizards?*

92.speaker: Narrator
92.text: *Karsus himself was rumoured to have created a crown of untold power. Could this be the crown being used to control the elder brain?*

41.speaker: Narrator
41.text: *'The Annals of Karsus' would no doubt have much to say about the crown's true nature, if only you could read them...*

139.speaker: Player
139.text: (Sounds perfect. How much for me to buy it from you?)

33.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
33.text: (Buy? Books as temperamental as these are not on sale. They are secured in our vault, where none can harm them, nor can they do any harm.)
33.context: NodeContext: Almost amused at the thought such books would be for sale - shutting the prospect down.

48.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
48.text: (Consider yourself lucky to have learned of such a book's existence. And then forget about it - the Annals of Karsus are best left unread.)

27.speaker: Player
27.text: (Surely there's some amount of gold that could convince you to part with the book?)

107.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
107.text: (Pssht. I already told you - it is locked in our vault. And with good reason - imagine if a tome so dangerous were sold to someone with such poor comprehension...)
107.context: NodeContext: Turtting to herself on the last part of the lines

39.speaker: Player
39.text: (I came here all the way from Neverwinter to admire your collection. Couldn't I just peek in the vault?)

143.speaker: Player
143.text: (Unless you want a very nasty paper cut, you're going to tell me how to get into that vault.)

125.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
125.text: (Customers like you are why I prefer the company of books.)
125.context: NodeContext: With a sigh - reluctantly going to tell you something

133.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
133.text: (The only way to gain access to the vault is through my office. And before you ask - no, you are not allowed in there either.)

83.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
83.text: (The vault is strictly prohibited for customers. And if you don't cease this foolishness, the rest of Sorcerous Sundries will be as well.)
83.context: NodeContext: Scolding - not interested in whatever game you're playing

122.speaker: Player
122.text: (Isn't it your job to share knowledge, not keep it locked away? At least tell me where the vault is...)

54.speaker: Player
54.text: (Isn't it your job to share knowledge, not keep it locked away? At least tell me where the vault is...)

22.speaker: Player
22.text: (Thank you. I've learned more than enough.)

66.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
66.text: (You certainly have. Even simple knowledge of these tomes is enough to stimulate most.)

130.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
130.text: (Interesting choice. If I didn't know better, I'd think you might have 'The Necromancy of Thay' in your possession.)

20.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
20.text: (I'd advise tremendous care with the 'Tharchiate Codex'. The cost of unlocking its mysteries is onerous.)

8.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
8.text: (Its author was a spectacularly talented halfling. She was - allegedly - able to establish contact with members of the Seelie Court.)

89.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
89.text: (Can you even imagine what wonders the fey pantheon might've revealed? Incredible.)

85.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
85.text: (You've heard about the Red Knight, I trust? Devout strategist, made exarch of Tempus.)

128.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
128.text: (This treaty is a compilation of her own design, kept here on the Material Plane for the benefit of us mortals. Quite rare.)

7.speaker: Player
7.text: (Can I buy one of these rare tomes?)

131.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
131.text: (I'm happy to describe the wonders that lie between their covers, but I'm afraid purchasing them is simply out of the question.)

35.speaker: Narrator
35.text: *Tolna may prefer to whisper, but it's her silence now speaking volumes. These books will never be for sale.*

141.speaker: Player
141.text: (I came here all the way from Neverwinter to admire your collection. Couldn't I just peek in the vault?)

49.speaker: Player
49.text: (Unless you want a very nasty paper cut, you're going to tell me how to get into that vault.)

79.speaker: Player
79.text: (Isn't it your job to share knowledge, not keep it locked away? At least tell me where the vault is...)

62.speaker: Player
62.text: (Isn't it your job to share knowledge, not keep it locked away? At least tell me where the vault is...)

40.speaker: Player
40.text: IS THAT TRUE, BOOKS? ARE YOU SENSITIVE?

56.speaker: Player
56.text: HOW ARE YOU FEELING, BOOKS? STILL SENSITIVE?

1.speaker: Player
1.text: What do you think of the new master of the tower?

4.speaker: Player
4.text: So Lorroakan got his Nightsong after all.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: The master of the tower is dead - I'm not sure he has a replacement. What will you do?

63.speaker: Player
63.text: (What do you think of the new master of the tower?)

127.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
127.text: (Who now? Oh. Rolan. I leave him alone. He leaves me alone. That's all there is to it, I'm happy to say.)

121.speaker: Player
121.text: (So Lorroakan got his Nightsong after all.)

134.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
134.text: (I'd prefer not to discuss that beastly business.)

119.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
119.text: (Sorcerous Sundries is an institution of this city, one I am proud to serve, even if it passes through some rather loathsome hands from time to time.)

21.speaker: Player
21.text: (The master of the tower is dead - I'm not sure he has a replacement. What will you do?)

91.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
91.text: (The same as I've always done. I deal in knowledge, not proprietors. Quietly getting on with things is a virtue, you know.)

80.speaker: Player
80.text: A quiet haven surrounded by books. I could get used to this.

118.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
118.text: (Whisht! These books are sensitive. They prefer an environment of quiet reverence.)
118.context: NodeContext: Shushing the player, finger in front of mouth like a librarian

46.speaker: Player
46.text: (A quiet haven, surrounded by books. I could get used to this.)

5.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
5.text: (Wouldn't trade it for the world, so I wouldn't. Anything I can help you with?)

90.speaker: Player
90.text: What do you have on offer?

77.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
77.text: (Scrolls, parchments, codices, tomes... Take a look and see what calls you.)
